tweet: Wishing you and your family a #HappyThanksgiving to reflect on all of the goodness of the last year. The dinner table may not always agree on politics, but Thanksgiving is a day for us to come together with gratitude. pic.twitter.com/FVtcnt7APm

When a business builds something here - and it’s supported by our tax dollars - it ought to use our workers. #DoTheRightThing, @amazon! #Solidarity #UnionStrong https://twitter.com/AlleghenyLabor/status/1197593364503441408 …

We passed 18 bills to improve health, the environment, and internet services. Many of them had bipartisan support - including my three bills addressing cyber-security, airwave sharing, and greater consumer rights and billing transparency for cable/satellite TV services. https://twitter.com/EnergyCommerce/status/1197907645056860160 …

As @ABeautifulDay shows in theaters today, we continue to celebrate the legacy of Fred Rogers and his role in #PGH. In 2003, I introduced a resolution in his memory – and I will continue to honor his legacy of neighborly love and wisdom.
 https://www.c-span.org/video/?175439-1/tribute-fred-rogers …

I’m an original cosponsor of the 100% Clean Economy Act, which would set a nationwide goal of achieving net zero carbon emissions by 2050. This bill would protect our planet for the future and strengthen our economy by creating new good paying jobs. #100by50 #ClimateChange pic.twitter.com/kZabTpJSVp

Health care and social services workers are four times more likely to face workplace assault or injury than any other workers. Today, I voted yes on H.R. 1309, a bill to require health care and social services employers to develop workplace violence prevention plans.
I worked with @RepKinzinger on H.R. 4461, the Network Security Information Sharing Act. Glad that it passed @EnergyCommerce today! https://twitter.com/EnergyCommerce/status/1197305367828553728 …

Maternal mortality rates are rising, but moms on Medicaid can only access care for 2 months after giving birth. H.R. 4996, the MOMS Act, would extend coverage for up to a year and increase federal funding – and I’m glad to support it! https://twitter.com/EnergyCommerce/status/1197294604003020802 …

I worked with my colleague @RepAnnaEshoo to ensure that language from her #TrueFeesAct was included in H.R. 5035, the Television Viewer Protection Act, which the @EnergyCommerce Committee approved today.

This legislation would apply consumer rights and transparency requirements to consumers’ cable and satellite bills. It would also give small rural cable providers the ability to negotiate together for programming from the largest broadcasting groups. A big win for consumers!

Consumers should know how much their cable or satellite service costs before they sign up! I’m pleased that a bill that I introduced to ensure transparency in billing – H.R. 5035, the Television Viewer Protection Act – passed @EnergyCommerce with bipartisan support today.

Congratulations to @CarnegieMellon for being awarded ARPA-E funding! This funding aims to develop streamlined solutions to next-generation energy challenges. Carnegie Mellon is a leader in energy innovation!
 https://arpa-e.energy.gov/sites/default/files/documents/files/DIFFERENTIATE_Project_Descriptions_FINAL.pdf …

Today, the House voted on several bills to protect endangered species and public lands, including H.R. 1446, the Multinational Species Conservation Fund, and H.R. 925, the North American Wetlands Conservation Extension Act. I'm glad to see these bills passed!

We're back in @EnergyCommerce to discuss bipartisan bills to address telecommunications issues – H.R. 5035, H.R. 4461, and H.R. 4462. These bills will encourage innovation, protect consumers, and secure our networks. https://twitter.com/EnergyCommerce/status/1197236459809492992 …

I’m pleased this draft incorporates my bill, H.R. 2096, the Energy Storage Tax Incentive and Deployment Act, which would expand the investment tax credit to include energy storage technologies. We must generate green jobs and meet our clean energy goals! https://go.usa.gov/xp9PZ

Sustainably moving toward clean energy is key to curbing #ClimateChange – and energy storage is a critical technology to meeting #100by50. Today, @WaysMeansCmte released a draft of the Growing Renewable Energy and Efficiency Now (GREEN) Act to incentivize clean energy.

We can't stand by as tobacco companies exploit young Americans, getting them hooked. H.R. 2339, the Reversing the Youth Tobacco Epidemic Act, would raise the age to buy tobacco to 21, ban flavors in tobacco products and online sales of e-cigarettes, and reform marketing rules. https://twitter.com/EnergyCommerce/status/1196889263348092934 …

I’m happy that the House and Senate have to come an agreement on #Robocall legislation I introduced with my colleagues! It’s time to give Americans the tools they need to block spam calls – and hold scammers accountable. https://www.post-gazette.com/news/politics-nation/2019/11/18/robocalls-laws-mike-doyle-bipartisan-deal-block-automated-calls/stories/201911180084 …

During today’s impeachment hearings, @HouseDems are:

- Holding a markup on 18 bills to address e-cigarettes, asbestos, and network security – including two of my bills
- Holding a hearing on student loans and Forever GI Bill implementation
- Voting to fund the government.

This facility will create jobs and promote economic growth, so I was happy to work with my colleagues in the local Congressional delegation in support of this grant application. The value of bipartisan regional support for federal infrastructure funding can’t be underestimated.

Air cargo is an important component of any region’s intermodal transportation system – and this week, I received notification that Allegheny County Airport Authority has been awarded $18 million for the construction of a cargo processing facility to expand air cargo operations.

Glad to see this recognition of Steve Miller and Janet Waldeck for their commitment to inspiring and educating the next generation. The #ParisAgreement laid out our path to sustainably transition to a clean energy future, create new green jobs, protect our air and water, and lead the rest of the world to do the same. We must continue to #ActOnClimate!

President Trump’s decision to formally pull out of the #ParisAgreement is destructive. As communities across the country experience firsthand the consequences of #ClimateChange, @POTUS is walking away from our opportunity to protect the environment for future generations.

We urgently need to #ActOnClimate! Our power sector is responsible for 1/3 of greenhouse gas emissions, and we have to find solutions to reach #100by50. I’ve introduced H.R. 2096 to improve our energy storage, and I was glad to take part in this @EnergyCommerce hearing last week. https://twitter.com/CleanAirMoms_PA/status/1190602454770974720 …
